title: (x) "My Tools Application Checklist" tech sans - FF DIN {Geoff}
content:
I have been looking everywhere for this font to no avail.  
I thought Neutraface came fairly close but there are obvious differences like ‘A’ and ‘P’. Also it looks fairly different in lower case.  
Unfortunately what I have is a very limited sample.

Does anyone have any idea?

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/font_sample.gif)

jayrom
author: jayrom

comments.content:
If that’s the actual size of it, it may just be a bitmap (screen) font, which are often used for navigation buttons. In other words, this may not be a ‘normal’ font that you could print, because bitmap fonts only look good at low screen resolutions.

- Mike Yanega
Mike, I highly doubt this is a bitmap font as there is evident anti-aliasing which would not normally occur in the use of bitmap fonts.

Thanks for the feedback.  
I do not think it is a bitmap font. This is an actual image that was created by a designer who has since disappeared without bothering to let me know which font she used!  
I looked at FF DIN but it seems to me the ‘H’ and ‘E’ are fairly different, with the middle stem(?) being a lot lower in the font I posted.  
This characteristic is what made me first believe that it was Neutraface.

jayrom

\> _I looked at FF DIN but it seems to me the ‘H’ and ‘E’ are fairly different, with the middle stem(?) being a lot lower in the font I posted._

That’s because the type size is really small in relation to the pixel size. Quite often the horizontal stems “jump” up or down a pixel when anti-aliasing. I’m positive this is DIN.

Great! I will get FF DIN then and start working ;-)  
Thank you so much for all the help, you have no idea how much time I’d spent trying to figure this out.

jayrom
